snippet: Two of the attacks took place in outdoor food markets, and the variety of methods used has exacerbated a sense of fatalism in the country where there has been an upsurge of violence.
abstract: Truck with explosives hidden in its cargo explodes in Diwaniya, a largely Shiite city in southern Iraq, killing at least 40 people; explosion is the deadliest in a string of attacks in central and southern Iraq on the same day, continuing a surge in violence and exacerbating a sense of fatalism in the country.

byline.contributor: Duraid Adnan contributed reporting from Baghdad, and employees of The New York Times from Karbala, Diwaniya and Baquba, Iraq.

lead_paragraph: Two of the attacks took place in outdoor food markets, and the variety of methods used has exacerbated a sense of fatalism in the country where there has been an upsurge of violence.

headline.seo: At Least 50 Killed in Iraq by Bombs and Gunfire
headline.main: Dozens Killed in Rising Iraqi Violence, Including at Least 40 by Truck Bomb
headline.print_headline: Dozens Killed in Rising Iraqi Violence, Including at Least 40 by Truck Bomb
